project.teaser: MRV4SOC aims at designing a comprehensive, robust, and cost-effective Tier 3 approach, accounting for changes in as many C pools as possible, to estimate GHG and full C budgets, coupling C and N cycles, quantify Soil Organic Carbon (SOC) accumulation, and assess the results of...
project.objective: MRV4SOC aims at designing a comprehensive, robust, and cost-effective Tier 3 approach, accounting for changes in as many C pools as possible, to estimate GHG and full C budgets, coupling C and N cycles, quantify Soil Organic Carbon (SOC) accumulation, and assess the results of traditional management practices and C farming. The main challenges addressed in MRV4SOC are: i) monitoring changes in SOC accumulation due to climate change and socio-economic pressures; ii) accounting for C and N cycles in full C budgets; iii) development of scientifically-sound, standard, and transparent Tier 3 methodology at different scales, iv) implementation of high-quality in-situ and RS data for testing methods and scale-up purposes; iv) standardisation of Monitoring, Reporting, and Verification schemes to ensure transparency, robustness, and cost-effectiveness; and v) a lack of trust in Voluntary Carbon Markets. To overcome these challenges, MRV4SOC will develop 6 specific objectives, which will be measurable, verifiable, and monitored through KPIs pointing at specific targets. MRV4SOC proposes a comprehensive 3-year work plan that ranges from the assessment of C pools in 9 land use/ land cover classes located in 14 Demonstration Sites (DS); to the potential integration of the approacMRV4SOC aims at designing a comprehensive and robust Tier 3 approach accounting for changes in as many C pools as possible (above-ground biomass, below ground-biomass, litter, dead wood, soil organic carbon, and harvested wood products) fully aligned with national GHG reporting. MRV4SOC seeks to develop solutions applicable for different spatio- temporal scales and climate change scenarios and validated for a wide variety of ecosystems in arid, temperate, and continental climate zones in collaboration with local stakeholders. The proposed approach will help establish reliable and transparent C farming credits within a cost-effective monitoring, reporting, and verification (MRV) methodological framework.
project.title: Monitoring, Reporting and Verification of Soil Organic Carbon and Greenhouse Gas Balance
project.keywords: Soil MRV, SOC, Carbon farming, Carbon removals verification, Standardise Tier-3 methodologies, Carbon markets, Carbon farming social economic impact, Soil living labs Innovative technologies for SOC a

article.title: Assessing reliable soil organic carbon accumulation for carbon farming

result.title: Uncertainty analysis based on a set of Simulations at Demonstration Site v1.0
result.description: With the new version of the land surface model ORCHIDEE we will run test simulations over the demostration sites

result.title: Data Management Plan v1.0
result.description: This plan describes the data types generated through R&I and demonstrations phases of the project, the plans for sharing/protecting them, storage, back-up, data protection measures, copyright, IPR and the consent-forms handed to the participants of project activities.

result.title: A framework for mapping conservation agricultural fields using optical and radar time series imagery

details.authors: Yue Zhou, Manon S. Ferdinand, Jelle van Wesemael, Klara Dvorakova, Philippe V. Baret, Kristof Van Oost, Bas van Wesemael
Junbin Zhao; Simon Weldon; Alexandra Barthelmes; Erin Swails; Kristell Hergoualc'h; Ülo Mander; Chunjing Qiu; John Connolly; Whendee L. Silver; David I. Campbell

result.title: Guidelines for Community Management at Sub-landscape Level
result.description: Guidelines document in order to develop and manage a CoP and the involvement of key actors as member of the CoP.As well as, the document will include the list of contact point of each landscape involved.

result.title: Report on Current GHG Modelling Efforts related to C Farming
result.description: This document will summarize the existing approaches and how they will be integrated in the ORCHIDEE model

result.title: Long-term stability of soil spectral libraries with chemical and spectral insights

details.authors: Jonti Evan Shepherd, Ori Kanner, Or Amir, Bar Efrati, Eyal Ben-Dor
details.publisher: Springer Science and Business Media LLC

result.title: Capability Building Materials for Demonstration Sites v1.0
result.description: The initial version of the delivarable will presente the methodlogical framework fo the capacity building programme,including targets, actions, and timing. Updated regularly for documenting the progress and potential refinements.

result.title: A New Open ORCHIDEE Version v1.0
result.description: A new version of the land surface model ORCHIDEE will be delivered with explicit representation of several key land management processes

result.title: Abstracts Compilation of Published Scientific Papers v1.0
result.description: These deliverables will relate the information included in scientific publications developed along the project and derive conclusions useful for the progress of the project. The final update will include the main highlights of the whole project. It will be published with a DOI.

result.title: Les solutions fondées sur la nature : Un levier important pour atténuer le changement climatique à condition d’aller de pair avec une réduction drastique des émissions de gaz à effet de serre
Clustering and Synergies Report v1.0
result.description: This report will include information on joint activities with other related projects (such as NOVASOIL or InBestSoil), like online/offline campaigns, co-publications, and participation in events (workshops, meetings, webinars, etc.).

result.title: Report on the Factors Hindering/Enabling Stakeholders’ and Farmers’ Adoption of C Farming
result.description: The deliverable will contain the final map of factors hindering/enabling stakeholders and farmers to adopt C Farming in each Region.

result.title: Political Framework Analysis
result.description: Analysis of the European and International political framework of the public financing tools in the agricultural and forestry sectors aimed at improving soil management towards increased C stocking, analyising also the interaction with the private voluntary carbon market.

details.authors: Marie‐Christin Wimmler; Nadezhda Nadezhdina; Hannah Bowen; Susana Alvarado‐Barrientos; Teresa David; Gabriela Fontenla‐Razzetto; Britt Kniesel; Holger Lange; Roman Mathias Link; Yang Liu; Jorge López‐Portillo; Clara Pinto; Junbin Zhao; Alejandra G. Vovides

result.title: Demonstration Site Guidelines v1.0
result.description: These deliverables will include details of the logistics and management in Demonstration Sites. Standard guidelines will be developed to ensure consistency among regions.

result.title: Data Reference Framework
result.description: This deliverable will present the comprehensive analysis of existing sensors and technologies related to MRV4SOC. It will include also reference dataset of indicators that are critical for MRV, including data of different spatial, temporal and spectral resolutions.

result.title: Remote Sensing Data Inventory v1.0
result.description: This task will focus on providing a set of quantitative spatial explicit indicators (e.g., bare soil reflectance composites, physico-chemical soil properties, statistics about soil exposure, etc.) able to support the description of surface state of the differentland uses, with associated uncertainty maps, that can be ingested directly into the bio-geochemical modelling analysis. The task will further build on top of past research done within WORLDSOILS project and it will exploit Copernicus data (Sentinel data) and Copernicus Contributing Missions (EnMAP, DESIS, PRISMA) data. Novel computational intelligence sensors (e.g. UAV, LIDAR) and methodologies will be also deployed to i) directly enhance the AI models; and ii) development of new data product based on a limited number of ground truth data.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - MRV4SOC (Monitoring, Reporting and Verification of Soil Organic Carbon and Greenhouse Gas Balance)
result.teaser: Soil organic carbon (SOC) plays a crucial role in regulating ecosystem services, particularly in terms of managing greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions to mitigate climate change. In this context, the activities carried out in the EU-funded MRV4SOC project are mainly focused on...

category.title: machine learning
category.displayCode: /natural sciences/computer and information sciences/artificial intelligence/machine learning

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
